div.pre: 445 Pontoleibade-Kilkis, Macedonia, 1961 Burial: c. 280 B.C. (T) Contents: 114+ AR. Pot hoard Alexander III: 67 lifetime and early post. tetradr. (Amphipolis 23, Pella 3, unc. Maced. 3, Sicyon 1, Lampsacus 1, Sardes 3, Chios 1, Amathus 1, Citium 1, Side 2, Tarsus 1, Aradus 3, Byblus 1, Tyre 4, Babylon 10, Susa 1, Alex- andreia 1, unc. 7) 33 dr. (chiefly Asia Minor mints) Philip III: 2 tetradr. (Aradus, Susa) 2 dr. Demetrius Poliorcetes: 5 tetradr. (Amphi- polis 2, Pella 2, Pelop.? 1) Athens: 5 tetradr. Disposition: Thessalonica 52; Athens 8 Varoucha, BCH 1962. pp. 418-21 (three hds.) Although published as separate deposits (hds. 2, 3, and 4) in the BCH, the composition of the three lots, their provenances and dates of discovery are so similar that there seems to be no doubt of a common origin. The 52 coins of hd. 2, said to be in the Athens cabinet, were seen in the Thessalonica museum by M. Oecono- mides
